DOCNAME: CASE OF CAHİT DEMİREL v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 5-3;Violation of Art. 5-4;Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Batman .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested by gendarmerie officers while he was leaving Batman . He was then transferred to ORG of ORG on suspicion of involvement in the activities of the ORG ( ORG , an illegal organisation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was brought before the Batman public prosecutor and the judge at ORG . The judge remanded the applicant in custody .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified day the Batman public prosecutor issued a decision of non - jurisdiction and sent the case file to the public prosecutor ’s office at ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor filed a bill of indictment against the applicant , along with other persons , charging him with membership of the ORG under LAW of the former LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held the first hearing on the merits of the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Fourth Chamber of ORG convicted the applicant as charged and sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment .

CARDINAL . NORP Throughout the proceedings , the applicant and his representative requested several times that the applicant be released pending trial . At the end of each hearing ORG rejected the applicant ’s requests , having regard to the nature of the offence , the state of the evidence and the content of the case file .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of the first - instance court . The case was subsequently remitted to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant ’s release pending trial .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG once again convicted the applicant under LAW of the former LAW and sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . Pursuant to Law no . CARDINAL of DATE , published in ORG on DATE , abolishing ORG , the case against the applicant was transferred to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided that the proceedings against the applicant should be terminated on the ground that the statutory timelimit under LAW had expired . This decision to terminate the case became final as neither the applicant nor the public prosecutor appealed .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice in force at the material time are outlined in PERSON and GPE v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE ) .
